manuscript.title: Nüzhetü't-Tarf fî İlmi's-Sarf
manuscript.author: Meydânî, Ebü'l-Fazl Ahmed b. Muhammed b. Ahmed el-Meydânî en-Nîsâbûrî (d. 518/1124)

paper_decoration.summary: The YEK catalogue describes 'bazi yapraklar renkli' (some leaves colored) within a paper stock otherwise identified as cream-colored with anchor watermarks (çapa filigranı). The specific colored leaves were not visually confirmed because all examined screenshots showed TUYATOK catalogue cards rather than manuscript folios. Classification as mülevven (colored leaves) rests on the explicit catalogue description by cataloguer Ayşegül Ökal. The date AH 1114/1702–03 provides a relatively firm production date for the risale, consistent with the European anchor-watermarked paper stock commonly used in late Ottoman manuscript production.

catalogue_description.paper_field: Capa filigranli krem rengi kagitlarin bazi yapraklar renkli
catalogue_description.notes_field: Soz baslari kirmizi. 283a da eserin fihristi var. GAL S.I. 507

key_indicators: Anchor watermark (çapa filigranı) typical of European paper imported into the Ottoman world in the 17th–18th centuries
Risale 23 of a large mecmûʿa; individual production context unknown
cross_tradition_caveats: Workshop location is entirely unknown; Çorum (Hasan Paşa collection) is a provincial Anatolian context but the manuscript may have been produced elsewhere
The mecmûʿa may be an assembled compilation of risales from different production contexts and dates
Colored leaves alone are insufficient evidence for workshop attribution without further analysis

paper.description: Cream-colored paper with anchor watermark (çapa filigranı); some leaves colored (bazi yapraklar renkli). Medium paper weight implied by 'krem rengi' description. The anchor watermark identifies the paper as of European origin or manufacture, consistent with Ottoman paper imports of the late 17th–early 18th century.
paper.watermark: Çapa filigranı (anchor watermark) — European paper stock

ruling.description: Section openings (söz başları) marked in red ink (kirmizi). A content index (fihrist) is noted at folio 283a of the host mecmûʿa.

binding.description: Şemseli, zencerekli, miklepli, sırtı siyah, üstü kahverengi meşin cilt — medallion-stamped (şemse), chain-border (zencirek), with flap (miklep), black spine, brown leather binding. The binding covers the full mecmûʿa 3286.

codicology.condition_summary: Condition not assessed; actual manuscript folios were not captured during visual confirmation (screenshots showed TUYATOK catalogue cards).

limitations: Coverage: the target risale (risale 23) was not located within the large mecmûʿa (367 pages); correct folio range unknown
Page 5 (p005) shows TUYATOK catalogue cards, not manuscript folios — a known issue with Hasan Paşa digitizations (documented in project Known Issues)
Colored leaf identification rests entirely on the YEK catalogue description; no visual verification achieved
No higher-resolution imaging available for this collection

bibliography.citation: Blair, Sheila S. 'Color and Gold: The Decorated Papers Used in Manuscripts in Later Islamic Times.' Muqarnas 17 (2000): 24–36.
bibliography.relevance: Foundational survey of colored paper types in Islamic manuscripts; directly relevant to the mülevven (colored leaf) classification.

bibliography.citation: Bloom, Jonathan M. Paper Before Print: The History and Impact of Paper in the Islamic World. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2001.
bibliography.relevance: Background on paper trade, watermarked European paper imported into the Ottoman world, and colored paper production techniques.

bibliography.citation: Brockelmann, Carl. Geschichte der arabischen Litteratur. Supplementband I (GAL S.I.). Leiden: Brill, 1937.
bibliography.relevance: The catalogue note 'GAL S.I. 507' identifies this as a recorded text; Brockelmann S.I. 507 corresponds to the Nüzhetü't-Tarf of al-Maydānī. Standard bibliographic reference for the text tradition.
bibliography.access_notes: Print; reference work. GAL S.I. = Supplementband I to Brockelmann's Geschichte der arabischen Litteratur.

bibliography.citation: Gacek, Adam. Arabic Manuscripts: A Vademecum for Readers. Leiden: Brill, 2009.
bibliography.relevance: Codicological reference for mecmûʿa structure, paper terminology, and the description of colored leaves in Arabic manuscript tradition.

suggested_collections.institution: Hasan Paşa Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — YEK Portal
suggested_collections.reason: The full mecmûʿa (3286) is digitized, but the IIIF viewer pages begin with TUYATOK catalogue cards. Targeted folio navigation past the catalogue cards is required to reach the manuscript folios and locate risale 23.

provenance.waqf: Hasan Paşa Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi, Çorum
provenance.notes: Risale 23 of composite volume mecmûʿa 3286. Dated AH 1114/CE 1702–03. Script: Taʿlîk. Language: Arabic (grammar/morphology text — Nüzhetü't-Tarf is an Arabic morphology work). Fihrist at f. 283a of host mecmûʿa. Cataloguer: Ayşegül Ökal. YEK ID: 127780; IIIF ID: 0000000123294. Text reference: GAL S.I. 507 (al-Maydānī, d. 518/1124).

analysis_metadata.image_quality_notes: Screenshot p005 shows TUYATOK catalogue cards, not manuscript folios — a documented issue with Hasan Paşa digitizations (see project Known Issues). No manuscript folios examined.
folios_examined: p005 (TUYATOK catalogue cards only — not manuscript folios)
analysis_metadata.folios_not_examined: All manuscript folios of risale 23. Folio range within mecmûʿa 3286 (367 pages) not identified. Targeted folio navigation required, navigating past opening TUYATOK cards to locate the actual manuscript content.
